original: HAGBERG, Olof Ragnar Emanuel, Civilingenjör, Norrköping, f By, Kopparb l, 28/12 03 av stnsmäst F A A H o Alma Pettersson, gm Lilly Hagenström. Ex tekn elem.sk Norrkp 24, KTH (VoV) 26-m E. tekn bitr v ö:a väg- o vattenbyggn.distr Norrkp 25—26, anst v Norrkps städs byggn.kont (vattenledn.vkt) 30—32, h ing Carl Hedberg Norrkp 32—36, vägförrättn.man fr 36, e.o. adj v tekn gymn Norrkp sed. 41. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Odd Fellow.
translated: HAGBERG, Olof Ragnar Emanuel, Civil Engineer, Norrköping, born in Fellingsbro, Kopparberg County, on December 28th, 1903. Son of station master F A A H and Alma Pettersson. Married to Lilly Hagenström. Former technical elementary school student in Norrköping until 1924, attended Royal Institute of Technology (VoV) from 1924 to 1926. Assistant engineer in the eastern road and water construction district in Norrköping from 1925 to 1926. Employed at Norrköping City Building Office (water pipeline department) from 1930 to 1932. Married to Carl Hedberg in Norrköping from 1932 to 1936. Road assessment officer from 1936. Deputy technical gymnastics instructor in Norrköping since 1941. Member of the Swedish Technical Association and Odd Fellow fraternity.

structured.name: Olof Ragnar Emanuel Hagberg

work.name: Eastern Road and Water Construction District

structured.description: Civil engineer Olof Ragnar Emanuel Hagberg was born on December 28th, 1903 in Fellingsbro, Kopparberg County, Sweden. He was the son of station master F A A H and Alma Pettersson. He married Lilly Hagenström. Hagberg completed his education at Technical Elementary School in Norrköping in 1924 and attended the Royal Institute of Technology (VoV) in Stockholm from 1924 to 1926. He worked as an assistant engineer at the Eastern Road and Water Construction District in Norrköping from 1925 to 1926. From 1930 to 1932, he was employed at Norrköping City Building Office in the Water Pipeline Department. He later served as a Road Assessment Officer at Norrköping City Building Office starting from 1936. Hagberg also held the position of Deputy Technical Gymnastics Instructor in Norrköping from 1941. He was a member of the Swedish Technical Association and the Odd Fellow Fraternity.

career.workplace: Eastern Road and Water Construction District, Norrköping
Norrköping City Building Office (Water Pipeline Department)
